title: Convoy 1: Research & Pattern Extraction
description:
Goal: Understand why the Oak Harbor model works in practice.

Tasks:
- Analyze the Oak Harbor Web Designs business model
- Extract operational insights shared publicly by the founder on Reddit (pricing philosophy, client limits, workflow, mistakes avoided)
- Distill patterns, not anecdotes

Outputs:
- A concise research brief
- A list of principles to carry forward
- A list of things explicitly NOT to do

title: Analyze Oak Harbor Web Designs business model
description:
Deep analysis of the Oak Harbor Web Designs business model:
- Subscription-based pricing structure
- Service offerings
- Target market
- Unique value proposition
- Business philosophy

Acceptance: Clear summary of how the business operates and why it succeeds.

title: Extract Reddit insights from Oak Harbor founder
description:
Search and compile operational insights the Oak Harbor founder has shared publicly on Reddit:
- Pricing philosophy discussions
- Client limit rationale
- Workflow descriptions
- Mistakes avoided
- Lessons learned

Acceptance: Organized collection of quotes/insights with source links.

title: Distill patterns into principles document
description:
Synthesize research into actionable guidance:
- Key principles to carry forward
- Anti-patterns to explicitly avoid
- Decision frameworks that have proven effective

Acceptance: Clear, concise document ready to inform all subsequent convoys.

title: Produce Convoy 1 Research Brief
description:
Final deliverable combining all Convoy 1 outputs:
- Executive summary of Oak Harbor model
- Principles list (things to do)
- Anti-patterns list (things NOT to do)
- Recommendations for this business

Acceptance: Single polished document suitable for reference throughout project.

title: Convoy 4: Technical Stack & AI Workflow
description:
Goal: Design a repeatable, AI-assisted build system.

Tasks:
- Define how Claude Code is used to generate and maintain sites
- Define how Figma AI is used for wireframes, visual direction, client previews
- Define handoff between design â†’ code
- Define repo/project structure

Outputs:
- End-to-end build workflow
- Tool responsibility map
- Example project skeleton

title: Define Claude Code workflow for site generation
description:
Document how Claude Code is used:
- Project initialization process
- Code generation patterns
- Component library approach
- Maintenance/update workflow
- Quality assurance steps

Acceptance: Repeatable workflow document with examples.

title: Define Figma AI workflow
description:
Document Figma AI usage:
- Wireframe generation process
- Visual direction development
- Client preview creation
- Iteration workflow
- Handoff to code process

Acceptance: Clear Figma workflow with tool responsibilities.

title: Define design-to-code handoff
description:
Document the handoff process:
- Design approval checkpoint
- Asset export process
- Code generation trigger
- Review and refinement loop

Acceptance: Clear handoff protocol preventing rework.

title: Define repo and project structure
description:
Establish standard project organization:
- Repository naming convention
- Directory structure
- File organization
- Documentation standards
- Version control practices

Acceptance: Template structure ready for new projects.

title: Produce Technical Workflow Documentation
description:
Final Convoy 4 deliverable:
- End-to-end build workflow
- Tool responsibility map
- Example project skeleton

Acceptance: Complete technical documentation.

title: Deacon Patrol
description: Mayor's daemon patrol loop for handling callbacks, health checks, and cleanup.

title: Convoy 5: Hosting, Domains & Deployment
description:
Goal: Make hosting boring, reliable, and scalable.

Tasks:
- Define default Vercel deployment strategy
- Define when AWS is used instead
- Define domain/DNS management approach
- Define uptime and responsibility boundaries

Outputs:
- Hosting decision tree
- Deployment checklist
- Client-facing hosting explanation

title: Define Vercel deployment strategy
description:
Document default Vercel approach:
- Project setup process
- Build configuration
- Environment management
- Preview deployments
- Production deployment

Acceptance: Clear Vercel deployment playbook.

title: Define AWS usage criteria
description:
Document when AWS is used instead of Vercel:
- Use case triggers
- Services used (S3, CloudFront, etc.)
- Cost considerations
- Setup process

Acceptance: Clear decision tree for hosting choice.

title: Define domain and DNS management
description:
Document domain handling:
- Registrar recommendations
- DNS setup process
- SSL certificate management
- Client vs company domain ownership
- Transfer procedures

Acceptance: Clear domain management protocol.

title: Define uptime and responsibility boundaries
description:
Document responsibility boundaries:
- What uptime is promised
- Monitoring approach
- Incident response
- What's company responsibility vs host responsibility
- Communication during outages

Acceptance: Clear SLA-adjacent document for client expectations.

title: Produce Hosting Documentation
description:
Final Convoy 5 deliverable:
- Hosting decision tree
- Deployment checklist
- Client-facing hosting explanation

Acceptance: Complete hosting package.

title: Convoy 8: 90-Day Execution Plan
description:
Goal: Turn this into reality without overwhelm.

Tasks:
- Week-by-week setup plan
- Tool setup order
- Demo site strategy
- First-client acquisition plan

Outputs:
- 90-day roadmap
- Weekly milestones
- Definition of 'launched'

title: Create week-by-week setup plan
description:
Break down 90 days into weekly milestones:
- Week 1-2: Foundation setup
- Week 3-4: Tool configuration
- Week 5-8: Demo site development
- Week 9-12: Launch and first client

Acceptance: Detailed weekly breakdown with specific actions.

title: Define tool setup order
description:
Sequence tool setup logically:
- Account creation order
- Integration dependencies
- Configuration checklist
- Testing requirements

Acceptance: Ordered setup checklist with dependencies.

title: Define demo site strategy
description:
Plan demo site development:
- Number of demo sites
- Industry/niche selection
- Feature showcase approach
- Maintenance plan

Acceptance: Demo site plan ready for execution.

title: Define first-client acquisition plan
description:
Plan first client acquisition:
- Outreach strategy
- Pricing flexibility for first clients
- Case study opportunity
- Success criteria

Acceptance: First client strategy ready to execute.

title: Define launch criteria
description:
Establish 'launched' definition:
- Minimum viable infrastructure
- Required documentation
- Legal requirements met
- First client capability

Acceptance: Clear launch checklist.

title: Produce 90-Day Roadmap
description:
Final Convoy 8 deliverable:
- 90-day roadmap document
- Weekly milestones
- Definition of 'launched'

Acceptance: Complete execution plan.

title: Convoy 9: Sustainability & Guardrails
description:
Goal: Ensure this business stays livable long-term.

Tasks:
- Define max client count
- Define pricing adjustment triggers
- Define burnout warning signs
- Define when to say no to growth

Outputs:
- Sustainability doctrine
- Decision rules
- Founder operating principles

title: Define maximum client count
description:
Establish sustainable client limits:
- Analysis of time per client
- Quality threshold considerations
- Revenue vs capacity tradeoffs
- Growth ceiling rationale

Acceptance: Clear max client number with supporting analysis.

title: Define pricing adjustment triggers
description:
Establish when to raise prices:
- Capacity utilization triggers
- Market rate adjustments
- Annual review process
- Existing client handling

Acceptance: Clear pricing review framework.

title: Define burnout warning signs
description:
Document early warning indicators:
- Workload metrics to watch
- Quality degradation signs
- Personal wellness indicators
- Response time slippage

Acceptance: Personal monitoring checklist.

title: Define growth refusal criteria
description:
Establish when to say no:
- Client type red flags
- Capacity constraints
- Scope mismatch
- Values misalignment

Acceptance: Clear 'say no' decision framework.

title: Produce Sustainability Doctrine
description:
Final Convoy 9 deliverable:
- Sustainability doctrine
- Decision rules
- Founder operating principles

Acceptance: Complete sustainability package.

title: Convoy 3: Pricing & Revenue
description:
Goal: Create sustainable, defensible pricing.

Tasks:
- Design subscription pricing tiers
- Define minimum commitments
- Define setup fees (if any)
- Model revenue at 10 / 25 / 50 clients
- Identify soft and hard client caps

Outputs:
- Pricing table
- Revenue projections
- Rationale document (for internal use)

title: Design subscription pricing tiers
description:
Create tiered subscription pricing:
- Entry tier (if any)
- Standard tier
- Premium tier (if any)
- What differentiates each tier
- Monthly vs annual options

Acceptance: Clear pricing structure with rationale.

title: Define minimum commitments
description:
Establish commitment requirements:
- Minimum contract length
- Cancellation terms
- Early termination handling
- Trial/pilot options

Acceptance: Clear commitment terms ready for contracts.

title: Define setup fees structure
description:
Determine one-time setup fees:
- Initial build fee
- Migration fee (from existing site)
- Rush setup premium
- Fee waivers/discounts

Acceptance: Clear fee structure with justifications.

title: Model revenue projections
description:
Create revenue models at different client counts:
- 10 clients scenario
- 25 clients scenario
- 50 clients scenario
- Time/effort estimates at each level
- Margin analysis

Acceptance: Spreadsheet or document with clear projections.

title: Identify client caps
description:
Determine sustainable client limits:
- Soft cap (when to slow intake)
- Hard cap (maximum clients)
- Factors that affect capacity
- Waitlist strategy

Acceptance: Clear capacity limits with reasoning.

title: Produce Pricing Documentation
description:
Final Convoy 3 deliverable:
- Pricing table
- Revenue projections
- Internal rationale document

Acceptance: Complete pricing package ready for use.

title: Refinery Patrol
description: Merge queue processor patrol loop with verification gates.

title: Convoy 7: Sales & Marketing (Introvert-Friendly)
description:
Goal: Attract the right clients without funnels or pressure.

Tasks:
- Define website positioning
- Define simple local SEO strategy
- Define referral flywheel
- Define what NOT to do (no cold spam, no funnels)

Outputs:
- Marketing strategy doc
- Website messaging outline
- Sample copy blocks

title: Define website positioning
description:
Establish website messaging:
- Value proposition
- Differentiation from competitors
- Trust signals
- Calm, professional tone
- Target audience appeal

Acceptance: Clear positioning document for website copy.

title: Define local SEO strategy
description:
Create simple local SEO approach:
- Google Business Profile setup
- Local directory listings
- Location-based keywords
- Review acquisition strategy

Acceptance: Actionable SEO checklist.

title: Define referral flywheel
description:
Design referral system:
- Referral incentives (if any)
- Ask timing
- Referral tracking
- Partner relationships

Acceptance: Simple referral process ready to implement.

title: Define marketing anti-patterns
description:
Document what NOT to do:
- No cold outreach
- No pressure tactics
- No funnel complexity
- No hustle culture messaging
- No aggressive upselling

Acceptance: Clear boundaries for marketing behavior.

title: Produce Marketing Documentation
description:
Final Convoy 7 deliverable:
- Marketing strategy doc
- Website messaging outline
- Sample copy blocks

Acceptance: Complete marketing package.

title: Convoy 2: Business Model & Services
description:
Goal: Define exactly what this company offers and refuses.

Tasks:
- Define ideal client profile
- Define core subscription offering
- Define optional one-time build offering
- Define add-ons
- Define explicit non-offerings
- Create scope guardrails to prevent creep

Outputs:
- Service catalog
- Scope rules
- Client qualification checklist

title: Define ideal client profile
description:
Create detailed ideal client profile:
- Business type and size
- Location considerations (local vs remote)
- Technical sophistication level
- Budget expectations
- Communication preferences
- Red flags to watch for

Acceptance: Clear profile document with qualification criteria.

title: Define core subscription offering
description:
Define the primary subscription service:
- What's included (hosting, maintenance, updates)
- Update frequency and scope
- Support response expectations
- What triggers additional charges

Acceptance: Clear service description suitable for client communication.

title: Define one-time build offering
description:
Define optional one-time website build option:
- Scope of build
- Handoff process
- Post-build support terms
- Pricing structure

Acceptance: Clear offering description with boundaries defined.

title: Define add-on services
description:
Define available add-on services:
- SEO services
- Additional pages
- E-commerce features
- Custom functionality
- Rush delivery

Acceptance: Add-on menu with clear pricing triggers.

title: Define explicit non-offerings
description:
Document what this company explicitly does NOT offer:
- WordPress/page builder work
- Full marketing services
- Social media management
- App development
- Etc.

Acceptance: Clear 'we don't do' list for setting client expectations.

title: Create scope guardrails document
description:
Establish scope management rules:
- How to handle scope creep requests
- What constitutes out-of-scope
- Escalation language for contracts
- When to say no

Acceptance: Internal guardrails document for consistent decisions.

title: Produce Service Catalog
description:
Final Convoy 2 deliverable:
- Complete service catalog
- Scope rules document
- Client qualification checklist

Acceptance: Polished documents ready for operational use.

title: Convoy 6: Client & Project Management (Bonsai)
description:
Goal: Make admin invisible and consistent.

Tasks:
- Define Bonsai proposal templates
- Define contract clauses aligned with subscription model
- Define invoicing cadence
- Define communication norms (async-first)

Outputs:
- Bonsai setup guide
- Template outlines
- Internal operating rules

title: Define Bonsai proposal templates
description:
Create proposal templates:
- Subscription proposal template
- One-time build proposal template
- Add-on proposal template
- Renewal proposal template

Acceptance: Ready-to-use templates in Bonsai.

title: Define contract clauses
description:
Establish contract language:
- Subscription terms
- Scope limitations
- Cancellation terms
- IP ownership
- Liability limitations

Acceptance: Lawyer-reviewed contract templates ready for use.

title: Define invoicing cadence
description:
Establish billing practices:
- Monthly vs annual billing
- Payment terms
- Late payment handling
- Automatic billing setup

Acceptance: Clear billing procedures documented.

title: Define communication norms
description:
Establish async-first communication:
- Preferred communication channels
- Response time expectations
- Meeting policies
- Status update frequency

Acceptance: Communication guidelines ready for client onboarding.

title: Produce Bonsai Setup Guide
description:
Final Convoy 6 deliverable:
- Bonsai configuration guide
- Template outlines
- Internal operating rules

Acceptance: Complete admin setup documentation.
